result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Paul Boehler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, with credit for 40 days (03-27-2015 to 05-01-2015 and 07-02-2015 to 07-06-2015) time served.

miscConds.notes:
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent BY 12-31-2016. Any remaining balance due will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
- Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution or unless authorized by law. 
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.

- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed or unless otherwise authorized by law. 
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:
- Court ordered defendant to serve 7 MONTHS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit;  release for ONLY The Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments at the House of correction. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. This is stayed to use as follows: 
* ANY violation of possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription OR possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor to serve all the condition time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Paul Boehler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packet

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 40 days (03-27-2015 to 05-01-2015 and 07-02-2015 to 07-06-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
 
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed or unless otherwise authorized by law. 
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution or unless authorized by law. 
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Court ordered defendant to serve 7 MONTHS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit;  release for ONLY The Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments at the House of correction. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. This is stayed to use as follows: 
* ANY violation of possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription OR possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor to serve all the condition time.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent BY 12-31-2016. Any remaining balance due will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing.

Amended Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant is charged as follows Possession of Narcotic Drugs, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41 (3g)(am), a Class I Felony.  Case proceeded to plea hearing.
Documents ordered sealed and to remain in file.

Defendant Brian Paul Boehler in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 17. Case set for plea hearing. Defense counsel does not object to Branch 25 hearing this matter. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Parties have agreed upon a sentencing date in Branch 17. State to file a proposed order to seal for the order for additional condition of bail. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Branch 17 in trial on another matter. Case spun to Branch 25.
